newsitem.title: FRANCE: P&O, Stena ferry merger decision due in May.
newsitem.headline: P&O, Stena ferry merger decision due in May.

text.p: P&O European Ferries said in a statement on Wednesday that a decision on its planned merger with Stena Line would be known before the end of May.

In a statement following a meeting with works councils of P&O European Ferries Calais, Stena Line Calais and Stena Line Dieppe, the company said that the merged unit would have assets of 410 million pounds and a fleet of 14 vessels.
"Awaiting the green light of the French, Belgian, British and European authorities, the decision on the merger of P&O Stena Line should be known before the end of May," it said.
Of the 14 vessels, three Stena vessels will be laid up.
A spokeswoman for the company said that the new British government's decision whether to allow the merger was crucial as "Brussels has indicated it would align itself with the British decision."
The two operators have been talking about a merger ever since the opening of the Channel Tunnel operated by Eurotunnel SA/Plc, which has led to a fall in prices and caused overcapacity.
Britain's Department of Trade and Industry long forbade the two from linking up but the matter is now in hands of the Mergers and Monopolies Commission (MMC).

P&O Stena Line would have a Calais/Dover service with departures every 45 minutes. It would use three freight ferries on Zeebrugge/Dover and the new rapid catamaran of Stena as well as a mixed ferry on Dieppe/Newhaven.
